metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1234 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the glob implementation in GNU C Library(aka glibc) before 2.24, when GLOB_ALTDIRFUNC is used, allowscontext-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a longname.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1234` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6.10').
